meanings.definition: Cause (something) to be out of focus.
meanings.sent1: When I move the camera too quickly, it defocusses the image.
meanings.sent2: The photographer defocusses the background to make the subject stand out.
meanings.sent3: Trying to take a picture while running defocusses everything!
meanings.sent4: Her tears defocussed her vision, blurring the world around her.
meanings.sent5: The fog defocusses the landscape, creating a dreamy effect.

meanings.sent1: When I'm tired, my mind defocusses and I can't concentrate.
meanings.sent2: The text defocusses as I read late into the night.
meanings.sent3: His thoughts defocussed as he daydreamed about his upcoming vacation.
meanings.sent4: The memory of that day slowly defocusses in my mind, becoming hazy.
meanings.sent5: The noise outside defocusses my thoughts, making it hard to focus on my work.
